explanation: Meaning/Usage: To agree after the other person demands it. Explanation: "Insist" means to demand something and that they will not accept refusal. explanation:
Hung is the past tense and past participle of hang in most of that verbâs senses. For instance, yesterday you might have hung a picture on the wall, hung a right turn, and hung your head in sorrow. The exception comes where hang means to put to death by hanging. The past tense and past participle of hang in this sense, and only in this sense, is hanged.

When someone is hung out of malice but with no intent to kill, as described in the example below, hung is the conventional word:

Example = (1)They hung him by chains and tortured him
(2)Two teenage boys that hung on to tree branches for two hours in the middle of Beaver Creek have been rescued.

explanation:
unique means being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else. synonyms:Â remarkable Â· special Â· singular Â· noteworthy Â· notable Â· signal Â· outstanding Â· extraordinary Â· unequalled Â· without equal Â· unparalleled Â· unmatched Â· matchless Â· peerless Â· nonpareil Â· unsurpassed Â· unexcelled Â· incomparable Â· beyond compare Â· superior Â· inimitable Â· second to none Â· unexampled

usual means somethingÂ habitually or typically occurring or done; customary. synonyms habitual Â· customary Â· accustomed Â· wonted Â· normal Â· routine Â· regular Â· constant Â· standard Â· typical Â· established Â· recognized Â· set Â· fixed Â· settled Â· stock Â· conventional Â· traditional Â· orthodox Â· accepted Â· expected Â· predictable Â· familiar Â· average Â· general Â· ordinary Â· everyday Â· daily Â· quotidian
